"Adverts on Snapchat can be based on: • Your identity details and use of Snap services • Audience lists from advertisers and other partners • Your use of websites and apps that share activity with Snap
You can customise the information used to serve you adverts by going to Snapchat Settings → Additional Services: Manage → Ad Preferences."
Why am I seeing this ad?

Some adverts on Snapchat are based on things you do elsewhere. You can disable receiving adverts based on certain types of information, but you will still see adverts. Also, adverts may still be based on your use of Snap services.

Adverts on Snapchat appear in various places, such as Discover, Lenses and Stories. Adverts may be customised for you based on your activity in the app (such as which content you watch), profile details (such as your birthday), information from our advertising partners and other means. We’ve created our advertising products to be fun and engaging – we hope you like them!
Add friends to send Snaps and view their Stories.
Couldn’t add members to group. Please try again!
Adding a Snap to your Story allows your friends to view your Snap an unlimited number of times for 24 hours. You can change who can view your Story in Settings.
You can stop people from sending you location requests in Map Settings.

"Try the new, faster Snapchat Alpha! Some features may still be missing.
Please ensure any recently saved Memories finish backing up and you have no unsent Snaps or Chats before you continue."

"Snapchat is updating …
Hang tight, the app will restart when the update completes!"

"Snapchat is updating!
This may take up to 10 seconds …
The Snapchat icon on your homescreen will move when this update is complete.
Check your app folder to find it again!"

This requires clipboard access for Snapchat.
You will still see a similar number of ads if you disable this feature, but those ads may be less relevant to your interests.

"These are ads based on audience lists we receive from advertisers and other partners. For example, if you subscribe to your favourite artist's email list, they may ask us to show you an ad for their latest album."

Use your microphone to record audio for Snaps, video chat, and more.

Allow Snapchat to access your camera and local storage to take photos and videos, detect screenshots, and more.
To use Snapchat, please allow access to your camera. Snapchat cannot take photos and videos without this permission.
To share your location, you’ll need to enable “Location Services” in your device’s settings.
To use Snapchat, please allow access to your local storage. Snapchat cannot detect screenshots, save certain content, scan Snapcodes and more without this permission.
Friends can see that you’ve deleted something.
Everyone in the group can see that you’ve deleted something.

When you delete a message, we’ll attempt to remove it from our servers and your friends’ devices. This might not always work, like if someone has a bad Internet connection or an old version of Snapchat.

"

Please read both to make sure you're up-to-date on any changes that are important to you! To get started here are a few key changes:

  • The Snap family of companies keeps growing! We’ve clarified which services are covered by our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, and when data may be shared among Snap companies.
  • We’ve made it easier to understand the licence you grant us over the content you create.
  • We’ve provided more information about advertising and the choices available to you.

Also, Snaps in Memories can now be uploaded to our servers with “Smart Backup”, which uses Wi-Fi and mobile data. In some regions this will be turned on by default. Check your settings for more!

"
